medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began two days prior to admission with generalized abdominal pain, decreased oral intake, and vomiting. The patient experienced severe epigastric pain, nausea, and vomiting on the evening of the visit. Pain was described as mild discomfort upon arrival to the ICU, with no current chest pain or shortness of breath reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic Atrial Fibrillation, Hypertension, Osteoarthritis, history of SBO s/p LOA
